summary: This document is an email chain from May 2021 between defense attorneys and prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, discussing technical discovery issues related to electronic evidence seized from Jeffrey Epstein's devices. The correspondence focuses on metadata, file formats, and logistical challenges in providing discovery to Maxwell at the MDC.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with prosecutors about discovery issues and logistical challenges in getting evidence to his client.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C., defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, involved in detailed technical discussions about discovery metadata and file formats.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on discovery-related correspondence.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on discovery-related correspondence.

persons.name: Thomas J. Powers
persons.context: Attorney from Christian Everdell's office who needs to be set up with a USAfx account to receive discovery.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case, referenced as being unable to review files at the MDC and needing discovery materials provided in specific formats.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the source of electronic devices from which evidence was seized, with files recovered from his residences and devices.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case, mentioned as someone who might need to issue an order if the MDC refuses to accept a discovery drive from defense counsel.

connections.description: Everdell is defense attorney representing Maxwell, working to get discovery materials to her at the MDC.
Menninger is defense attorney for Maxwell, involved in detailed discovery discussions on her behalf.
Sternheim is defense attorney for Maxwell, copied on discovery correspondence.
Pagliuca is defense attorney for Maxwell, copied on discovery correspondence.
Both work at the same law firm, with Everdell asking for Powers to be included in discovery communications.
Maxwell is charged in relation to Epstein's activities, with evidence coming from Epstein's devices and residences.

events.title: Searches of Epstein residences
events.description: FBI searches of Jeffrey Epstein's residences where CDs containing images were seized.

events.title: November 9, 2020 discovery production
events.description: Prosecution produced discovery including images from CDs seized during 2019 searches of Epstein residences.

events.title: October 20, 2020 production
events.description: Prosecution produced videos converted from VHS and cassette tapes from SDFL or PBPD investigations.

events.title: Discovery issues discussion
events.description: Defense raises multiple technical issues with discovery including missing attachments, metadata problems, and logistical challenges getting materials to Maxwell at MDC.

keyFacts: Over 109,000 emails were produced without attachments, with attachments appearing only as slip-sheets.
Over 110,000 electronic documents from Epstein's devices have metadata showing 'date created' or 'date last modified' dates in July 2020 or later, raising questions about evidence handling.
Over 6,500 photographs were produced without CART numbers and with creation dates after July 2019, creating chain of custody questions.
The MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) was refusing to accept a hard drive with discovery materials from defense counsel, requiring potential court intervention.
Images within Bates range SDNY_GM_00467566 through SDNY_GM_00514100 were seized during 2019 searches of Epstein residences and came from CDs, not from electronic device extractions.
